alert.note: Alert for Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 22 at 2:21AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...North Central and portions of northeast Florida, including the following areas, in northeast Florida, Eastern Putnam and Western Putnam. In north central Florida, Central Marion, Eastern Alachua, Eastern Marion, Gilchrist, Western Alachua and Western Marion. * WHEN...Through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has extended a Flood Watch for north central and portions of northeast Florida through Friday evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches, with locally higher amounts, are expected through Friday. These heavy rainfall totals over saturated soil conditions may lead to flooding, particularly at urban and normally flood prone, low lying areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
